column4: when i use the mkdir command in Ubuntu 6.06 amd64, it returns 'permission denied'.  how do i gain permission?
directories have "permissions".  you need to have permission to write to area's with retricted permissions

the reason I asked was that before I was told to read https://help.ubuntu.com/community/FirefoxAMD64FlashJava by someone in here.  The tutorial is nice, but it makes it look like i don't need to do anything but their step-by-step procedure...
i just recomended taking the wine approach with erider a minute ago.  i don't want to spam this channel by repeating, so just read your log :)
wait, why doesn't it look like you have anything to do?
because it's a simple 1-2-3-4 step by step tutorial.  wouldn't it mention chmod/chown if i had to do that?
btw, i'm sorry but it looks like i was a little late for the conversation with erider
why doesn't it look like you have anything to do according the howto?
i'm not quite sure what you mean by that.  i followed the steps of the how-to up until the 'mkdir' line and got stuck..
thank you!  i was trying su (without sudo) and it was denying me
hehe little things make a big difference :)
ubuntu doesn't configure su as you would expect by default.  they all like sudo.  freaks.
good to know.  thanks a million =)
